questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_1^2 \dfrac{3x^2+1}{\sqrt{x^3+x}}\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/6}\cos(3x)\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_2^{2e^6}\dfrac{1}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t)=-2t^2+8t-6\) m/s. On the interval \([0,5]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Factor: \(v(t)=-2(t^2-4t+3)=-2(t-1)(t-3)\). Zeros in \([0,5]\): \(t=1\) and \(t=3\). Check signs: \(v(0)=-6<0\), \(v(2)=-8+16-6=2>0\), \(v(4)=-32+32-6=-6<0\). Velocity changes sign at \(t=1\) and \(t=3\), so the particle changes direction 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=\dfrac{6}{x^2}\) on the interval \([1,3]\).
Let \(f(x)=\cos x-x\). Which of the following correctly applies the Intermediate Value Theorem to guarantee a zero?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(f(0)=1-0=1>0\) and \(f(\pi/2)=\cos(\pi/2)-\pi/2=0-\pi/2<0\). Since \(f\) is continuous and changes sign, there is a zero in \((0,\pi/2)\).

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{x^2}{y}\).
Let \(S(x)=\int_0^x\sin(t^2)\,dt\). Find \(S'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part 1 (the upper limit is simply \(x\)): \(S'(x)=\sin(x^2)\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=\ln(x^3+5x)\).
Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\cot(3x)\).
Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\dfrac{e^x-1}{x} & x\ne0\\k & x=0\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=0\)?
questions.explanation: \(\lim_{x\to0}\frac{e^x-1}{x}\) is the definition of the derivative of \(e^x\) at \(x=0\), which equals \(1\). Alternatively, by L'Hôpital: \(\lim\frac{e^x}{1}=1\). So \(k=1\).

questions.question: Find the x‑value of the inflection point of \(f(x)=\sin x\) on \((0,2\pi)\).
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=\cos x\), \(f''(x)=-\sin x\). Set \(f''=0\) on \((0,2\pi)\): \(\sin x=0\) ⇒ \(x=\pi\). At \(x=\pi\): \(f''\) changes from negative (for \(x\in(0,\pi)\)) to positive (for \(x\in(\pi,2\pi)\)), confirming an inflection point.

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\) for \(ye^x+xe^y=1\).
Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=\dfrac{1}{x^2}\) at the point \((1,1)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=-2x^{-3}\). At \(x=1\): tangent slope \(=-2\). Normal slope \(=\frac{1}{2}\). Equation: \(y-1=\frac{1}{2}(x-1)\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\dfrac{x}{x^2+1}\). Find the instantaneous rate of change at \(x=0\).
If \(m(1)=7\) and \(m(6)=-3\), find \(\int_1^6 m'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_1^6 m'(x)\,dx=m(6)-m(1)=-3-7=-10\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=x^2-3x\) on \([1,4]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((1,4)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\sqrt{x}\,e^x\).
A particle has velocity \(v(t)=-t^2+4t+5\) ft/s on \([0,5]\). Find the maximum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=x^2\ln x\) (for \(x>0\)) is decreasing.
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=2x\ln x+x^2\cdot\frac{1}{x}=x(2\ln x+1)\). For \(x>0\): \(f'(x)<0\) when \(2\ln x+1<0\) ⇒ \(\ln x<-\frac{1}{2}\) ⇒ \(x<e^{-1/2}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{e}}\). So \(f\) is decreasing on \((0,\frac{1}{\sqrt{e}})\).

questions.question: Is \(f(x)=|x^2-4|\) differentiable at \(x=2\)?
options: No; \(f\) is continuous at \(x=2\) but the left derivative is \(-4\) and the right derivative is \(4\)
Yes; \(f(2)=0\) so the function is smooth there
questions.explanation: Near \(x=2\): for \(x<2\), \(x^2-4<0\) so \(f=4-x^2\); for \(x>2\), \(x^2-4>0\) so \(f=x^2-4\). Left derivative: \(-2x\big|_2=-4\). Right derivative: \(2x\big|_2=4\). Since \(-4\ne4\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=2\).

questions.question: A spring has spring constant \(k=10\) N/m. How much work is done stretching it 0.5 m from its natural length?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) changes from negative to positive at \(x=-4\); from positive to negative at \(x=2\); and equals zero at \(x=6\) with positive values on both sides. Classify each critical point.
options: Min at \(-4\), max at \(2\), neither at \(6\)
Max at \(-4\), min at \(2\), neither at \(6\)
Min at \(-4\), max at \(2\), min at \(6\)
Max at \(-4\), min at \(2\), max at \(6\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: − to + at \(x=-4\) ⇒ relative minimum; + to − at \(x=2\) ⇒ relative maximum; positive on both sides of \(x=6\) ⇒ no sign change ⇒ neither.

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=\dfrac{2}{\sqrt{x}}\) from \(x=1\) to \(x=9\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)>0\), \(f'(a)<0\), and \(f''(a)=0\) where \(f''\) changes sign. What can be concluded?
options: \(f\) has an inflection point above the x‑axis where \(f\) is decreasing
\(f\) has a local minimum above the x‑axis
\(f\) has a local maximum above the x‑axis
questions.explanation: \(f(a)>0\) means above the x‑axis; \(f'(a)<0\) means decreasing; \(f''(a)=0\) with a sign change means \(x=a\) is an inflection point. All three conditions describe an inflection point above the x‑axis on a decreasing portion of the graph.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_{-2}^{2}(x^4+3x^2+1)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: All three terms are even functions, so \(\int_{-2}^2(x^4+3x^2+1)\,dx=2\int_0^2(x^4+3x^2+1)\,dx=2\left[\frac{x^5}{5}+x^3+x\right]_0^2=2\left(\frac{32}{5}+8+2\right)=2\cdot\frac{82}{5}=\frac{164}{5}\).

questions.question: Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=2x+3\) and \(y=x^2\).
For \(f(x)=\dfrac{x}{x^2-4}\) (where \(x\ne\pm2\)), the second derivative is \(f''(x)=\dfrac{2x(x^2+12)}{(x^2-4)^3}\). On which interval is \(f\) concave up?
questions.explanation: Since \(x^2+12>0\) always, the sign of \(f''\) is determined by \(\frac{x}{(x^2-4)^3}\). \(f''>0\) when \(x>0\) and \(x^2>4\) (i.e., \(x>2\)), or when \(x<0\) and \(x^2<4\) (i.e., \(-2<x<0\)). So \(f\) is concave up on \((-2,0)\cup(2,\infty)\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=3\arctan x\) at \(x=1\).
A plane flies horizontally at altitude 5 km with speed 600 km/h. When the horizontal distance from an observer is 12 km, how fast (in rad/hr) is the angle of elevation \(\theta\) changing?
A quantity decays according to \(A(t)=200\cdot\left(\dfrac{3}{4}\right)^t\). Find \(A(4)\).
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=(x-4)^2(x+2)^3\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Neither at \(x=-2\); relative max at \(x=\tfrac{8}{5}\); relative min at \(x=4\)
Relative min at \(x=-2\); relative max at \(x=4\)
Relative max at \(x=-2\); relative min at \(x=4\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=(x-4)(x+2)^2(5x-8)\). At \(x=-2\): factor \((x+2)^2\) is squared — no sign change — so neither. Test signs around \(x=8/5\): positive on \((-2,8/5)\), negative on \((8/5,4)\) ⇒ relative max. Negative on \((8/5,4)\), positive for \(x>4\) ⇒ relative min at \(x=4\).

questions.question: The function \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2+ax+b & x\le0\\\cos x & x>0\end{cases}\) is both continuous and differentiable at \(x=0\). Find \(a\) and \(b\).
questions.explanation: Continuity at \(x=0\): \(f(0^-)=0+0+b=b\) and \(f(0^+)=\cos(0)=1\), so \(b=1\). Differentiability: left derivative \(=2x+a\big|_0=a\); right derivative \(=-\sin(0)=0\). So \(a=0\). Verify: \(f(0)=1\), \(f'(0)=0\) ✓

questions.question: Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^4\sqrt{x+1}\,dx\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=\sin x+\cos x\) on \([0,2\pi]\).
The region bounded by \(y=x\) and \(y=x^2\) (for \(0\le x\le1\)) is rotated about the x‑axis. Find the volume using the washer method.
questions.explanation: On \([0,1]\): \(x\ge x^2\). Outer radius \(R=x\), inner radius \(r=x^2\). Volume \(=\pi\int_0^1(x^2-x^4)\,dx=\pi\left[\frac{x^3}{3}-\frac{x^5}{5}\right]_0^1=\pi\!\left(\frac{1}{3}-\frac{1}{5}\right)=\frac{2\pi}{15}\).

questions.question: At what x‑values on \(y=x^3-3x\) is the tangent line perpendicular to \(y=-\dfrac{1}{3}x+2\)?
questions.explanation: Slope of given line \(=-\frac{1}{3}\). Perpendicular slope \(=3\). Set \(y'=3x^2-3=3\) ⇒ \(3x^2=6\) ⇒ \(x^2=2\) ⇒ \(x=\pm\sqrt{2}\).

questions.question: Consider \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2+2x & x\le0\\\sin x & x>0\end{cases}\). Is \(f\) differentiable at \(x=0\)?
options: No; \(f\) is continuous but the left derivative is \(2\) and the right derivative is \(1\)
questions.explanation: Continuity: \(f(0^-)=0\) and \(f(0^+)=\sin(0)=0\) ✓. Left derivative: \(2x+2\big|_0=2\). Right derivative: \(\cos(0)=1\). Since \(2\ne1\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=0\).

questions.question: Let \(U(x)=\int_x^{x+1}t^3\,dt\). Find \(U'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC with variable limits in both bounds: \(U'(x)=(x+1)^3\cdot1-x^3\cdot1=(x+1)^3-x^3\). Expand: \(x^3+3x^2+3x+1-x^3=3x^2+3x+1\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\displaystyle\lim_{x\to\pi}\frac{\sin x}{x-\pi}\).
questions.explanation: Form \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply L'Hôpital: \(\lim_{x\to\pi}\frac{\cos x}{1}=\cos\pi=-1\). Alternatively, let \(t=x-\pi\): \(\lim_{t\to0}\frac{\sin(t+\pi)}{t}=\lim_{t\to0}\frac{-\sin t}{t}=-1\).

questions.question: Find the point(s) on the parabola \(y=x^2\) closest to \((0,2)\).
Use the Second Derivative Test to classify all critical points of \(f(x)=x^2e^{-x}\).
options: Relative minimum at \(x=0\) (\(f=0\)); relative maximum at \(x=2\) (\(f=4e^{-2}\))
Relative maximum at \(x=0\); relative minimum at \(x=2\)

questions.question: Use Simpson's Rule with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^4 x^2\,dx\).
questions.explanation: \(\Delta x=1\). Values: \(f(0)=0\), \(f(1)=1\), \(f(2)=4\), \(f(3)=9\), \(f(4)=16\). Simpson's: \(\frac{1}{3}(0+4(1)+2(4)+4(9)+16)=\frac{1}{3}(0+4+8+36+16)=\frac{64}{3}\). This equals the exact value since Simpson's Rule is exact for polynomials of degree ≤ 3.

questions.question: Find \(\dfrac{d}{dx}\!\left[\arctan\!\left(\dfrac{x}{4}\right)\right]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=t^3-t^2-t+1\). Find the acceleration when the velocity is zero for \(t\ge0\).
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=x^3-6x^2+9x+1\) on \([0,5]\).
options: Absolute max \(21\) at \(x=5\); absolute min \(1\) at \(x=0\) and \(x=3\)
Absolute max \(21\) at \(x=5\); absolute min \(1\) at \(x=3\) only
Absolute max \(5\) at \(x=1\); absolute min \(1\) at \(x=0\)
Absolute max \(21\) at \(x=5\); absolute min \(5\) at \(x=1\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=x^2y\), \(y(0)=4\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=\sin(\pi t)\) ft/s on \([0,3]\). Find the total distance traveled.
questions.explanation: \(v=0\) at \(t=0,1,2,3\). \(v>0\) on \((0,1)\), \(v<0\) on \((1,2)\), \(v>0\) on \((2,3)\). Each arc: \(\int_0^1\sin(\pi t)\,dt=\left[-\frac{\cos(\pi t)}{\pi}\right]_0^1=\frac{1}{{\pi}}+\frac{1}{\pi}=\frac{2}{\pi}\). By symmetry, each of the 3 arcs contributes \(\frac{2}{\pi}\). Total distance \(=3\cdot\frac{2}{\pi}=\frac{6}{\pi}\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=\bigl[\sin x+x^2\bigr]^5\).
questions.explanation: Chain rule: \(f'(x)=5(\sin x+x^2)^4\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(\sin x+x^2)=5(\sin x+x^2)^4(\cos x+2x)\).

questions.question: Use linear approximation at \(x=0\) to estimate \(e^{-0.1}\).
